From: Cisco IOS Configuration Fundamentals Command Reference
FuncDef: To set the interval that the EXEC command interpreter waits until user input is detected, use the **exec-timeout** command in line configuration mode. To remove the timeout definition, use the **no** form of this command.

ParaDef.Info: Integer that specifies the number of minutes. The default is 10 minutes.

ExtraInfo: If no input is detected during the interval, the EXEC facility resumes the current connection. If no connections exist, the EXEC facility returns the terminal to the idle state and disconnects the incoming session.To specify no timeout, enter the **exec-timeout** **0 0** command.
